intro: Palicourea quadrifolia subsp. leticiana, commonly known as the Letician velvetleaf, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. It produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and unique morphological traits.
